Summary After doing my masters from Indian Institute Of Science, i joined Intel India. Worked on various backend and frontend design of CPU core blocks. Developed knowledge base of X86 architecture and in depth knowledge about floating point arithmetic units. Also involved in various personal hobby projects and personal research activities involving system design, camera system development, motion activated camera, sensor networks (specially PIR sensor networks), board design,debug and bring up. On software side have developed many RTOS based systems, embedded C based library development, linux driver development and network socket programming projects. • Evaluated the performance of 3GPP W-CDMA Rake Receiver floating-point Matlab model for DPCH reception and PRACH detection and decoding. 
• Worked on the design enhancements and verification of seed generation for the scrambling code generator in fixed-point C++ model of W-CDMA receiver. RTL Design Engineer, Communications SOC Ittiam Systems July 2011  –  July 2013  (2 years 1 month) Bengaluru Area, India Played a key role in the development of Wireless LAN PHY layer IP. 
• Contributed from design of modules to integration to complete verification of 802.11ac PHY transmitter. 
• Designed Data Re-construction and Decision Directed Refining factor estimation modules to enhance the receiver sensitivity. 
• Designed block averaging and exponentially weighted moving average filters to assess the signal quality at the receiver. 
• Implemented Tx/Rx custom features in 802.11n PHY IP and verified them on FPGA validation platform. 
• Devised clock gating conditions to save power and verified them by inserting clock gating assertions. 
• Multiplier sharing and CSD multiplier implementation to optimize the use of multipliers in 802.11n PHY IP. 
• Worked with Systems team for bit-exact verification of 802.11n PHY receiver and 802.11ac PHY transmitter modules. 
• Performed Code Coverage analysis of the entire 802.11n PHY IP. 
• Automated the generation of test cases using Perl and performed rigorous RTL verification using the PHY test bench. 
• Contributed to resolving RTL related problems like lint warnings, CDC warnings and synthesis issues.
